thread.title: Coleen Nolan fears long-lost sister was one of Tuam babies whose remains were found in 'sewage tank'
thread.title_full: Coleen Nolan fears long-lost sister was one of Tuam babies whose remains were found in 'sewage tank'

author: Hayley Minn
title: Coleen Nolan fears long-lost sister was one of Tuam babies whose remains were found in 'sewage tank'

organizations.name: pa/press association images)  speaking to best

text:
Get daily   
Following the news that infant remains have been found in a 'sewage tank' at a well-known mother and baby home where 796 children died, Coleen Nolan has revealed her fears her long-lost sister was one of them. 
The human remains were found at an excavated site by the Mother and Baby Homes Commission in Tuam, Co Galway, Ireland. 
It told the Irish Times that remains recovered for the purpose of analysis involved a number of individuals with age-at-death ranges from approximately 35 foetal weeks to two to three years. 
Coleen, who found fame in 1974 with her band of siblings, The Nolan Sisters, discovered her dad fathered another child following an affair when she was in her twenties. Read More Coleen has a sister she never met (Photo: ITV) Her long-lost sister was born in Ireland (Photo: ITV) The entrance to the site of a mass grave in Ireland (Photo: Reuters) Hundreds of babies' remains were found here (Photo: REUTERS) 
And, speaking on Loose Women today, she confessed her worries about that sister having died at a mother and baby home in Ireland - as she knows she was born in Ireland. 
The Celebrity Big Brother winner said: "She could’ve been one of those babies. 
"It would’ve been around that time." 
Coleen and her sisters Maureen, Anne, Bernie, Linda and Denise never met their other sister. 
And she continued: "All this time, I've wondered, 'Did she die at childbirth? Was she adopted? Did she know about us?' Coleen got very emotional on Loose Women (Photo: ITV) She really hopes her sister wasn't there (Photo: ITV) 
"She would’ve been in Ireland around that time, and this is just one of the homes where they've found bodies. 
"As soon as I heard the news, I thought, 'Please don’t let her have been there.' 
Coleen, the youngest of eight siblings, previously confessed she thought her sister may have died. Read More Stacey Solomon 'cracks head on floor' after Jane Moore drops her LIVE on Loose Women Coleen is the youngest of many sisters (Photo: PA/Press Association Images) 
Speaking to Best magazine, she said: "We think the woman may have given her baby up for adoption. Or perhaps she’s out there, and has no idea about us. Worse, maybe she’s died. 
"I just felt so sorry for mum, who stuck with her husband despite his betrayal, and for the half-sister we never knew." 
*Loose Women continues on ITV1 weekdays at 12.30pm Coleen Nolan Like us on Facebook
